Those with upright and handsome bodies in this life come from the practice of patience, those who are ugly come from anger, those who are poor come from stinginess and greed, those who are noble come from paying homage, those who are lowly come from arrogance, those who are tall come from being respectful, those who are short come from despising the Dharma, those who are harsh come from being sheep, those who are dark come from obstructing the Buddha's light.

Being a human with a snake body comes from wearing light clothes and bumping into a Buddha image. Being a human with a dark complexion comes from placing a Buddha image under a roof eaves where it is smoked. Being a human with paralysis comes from seeing teachers and elders without rising. Being a human with a hunched back comes from entering and exiting with light clothes while turning one's back to a Buddha image. Those who have large and foul-smelling bodies, are prone to anger, and are difficult to understand come from among camels.

The various kinds of suffering mentioned above are all due to the karma of the ten evil deeds. The worst leads to the causes and conditions of hell, the middling to the causes and conditions of the animal realm, and the lowest to the causes and conditions of the hungry ghost realm.
Among them, the sin of killing can cause sentient beings to fall into hell, the animal realm, and the hungry ghost realm;
If reborn among humans, they will obtain two kinds of karmic retribution:
First, a short lifespan;
Second, they will suffer from many illnesses.
The crime of stealing also causes sentient beings to fall into the hells, animal realms, and hungry ghost realms;
If reborn as a human, they will obtain two kinds of karmic retribution:
First, poverty;
Second, not having control over shared wealth.
The crime of sexual misconduct also causes sentient beings to fall into the hells, animal realms, and hungry ghost realms;
If reborn as a human, they will obtain two kinds of karmic retribution:
First, their spouse will not be chaste;
Second, the two spouses will quarrel and not follow one's own mind.
The crime of false speech also causes sentient beings to fall into the hells, animal realms, and hungry ghost realms;
If reborn as a human, they will obtain two kinds of karmic retribution:
First, being slandered by many;
Second, constantly being deceived by many people.
The crime of divisive speech also causes sentient beings to fall into the hells, animal realms, and hungry ghost realms;
If reborn as a human, they will obtain two kinds of karmic retribution:
First, they will have a broken and destroyed retinue;
second, they will have a bad and evil retinue.
The sin of harsh speech also causes sentient beings to fall into the hells, animal realms, and hungry ghost realms;
if reborn among humans, they will obtain two kinds of karmic retribution:
first, they will always hear bad sounds;
second, their words will always be contentious.
The sin of frivolous speech also causes sentient beings to fall into the hells, animal realms, and hungry ghost realms;
if reborn among humans, they will have two kinds of karmic retribution:
first, people will not accept what they say;
second, their words will be unclear and unable to be understood.
The sin of greed also causes sentient beings to fall into the hells, animal realms, and hungry ghost realms;
if reborn among humans, they will obtain two kinds of karmic retribution:ğŸ”½first, they will be greedy for wealth without being satisfied;
second, they will seek much but never get what they want.
The sin of anger also causes sentient beings to fall into the hells, animal realms, and hungry ghost realms;
If reborn among humans, they will obtain two kinds of karmic retribution:
First, they will always seek out the faults of others;
Second, they will always be harmed by others.
The sin of wrong views also causes sentient beings to fall into the hells, animal realms, and hungry ghost realms;
If reborn among humans, they will obtain two kinds of karmic retribution:
First, they will always be born in a family with wrong views;
Second, their minds will always be deceitful.
Buddha's disciples!
These ten evil karmic paths are all the causes and conditions for the great accumulation of suffering.

At that time, among the great assembly there were those who had committed the ten evil deeds. Hearing the Buddha speak of the painful retributions of the hells, they all cried out loudly and said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!
What good deeds should disciples do to avoid this suffering?

The Buddha told Ananda:
As I have said in various sutras, I encourage sentient beings to read, recite, and practice the causes and effects, so that they may be liberated from suffering;
If one hears this sutra and gives rise to slander, that person's tongue will fall out in this present life.
